results.title: [Darcy Prendergast's Light Pen Animation]
results.brief_description: Animator Darcy Prendergast was commissioned by ACMI to make some light-hearted works – representing film, TV and games – for display on screens throughout the ACMI building. Using his lightpen technique and combining computer animated movement with real-life locations, the films are a ‘hat-tip’ to the internationally popular feature films and characters of the Australian film industry.
results.description: Animator Darcy Prendergast was commissioned by ACMI to make some light-hearted works – representing film, TV and games – for display on screens throughout the ACMI building. results.title: Whole School Planning
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studies in effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have improved their effectiveness. The first episode, “Whole school planning” looks at planning as a manageable series of arrangements designed to involve all interested parties and to make the best use of limited resources. Deer Park Secondary College features in this case study.

results.title: Sharing: the School Community Library
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: In some Victorian schools joint-use libraries have already been developed where both the school and the community share the same library facilities. This film, for librarians, administrators, and educators examines the problems and advantages of the community library concept as developed at Templestowe Technical School and Nathalia Primary School.

results.title: Adventure Games in the Classroom
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Outlines how to integrate the computer into the classroom by using an adventure games approach. The emphasis is on situations where only one computer per class is available.

results.title: Wandering Thru' the Centre
results.brief_description:
A travel film through the centre of Australia. Features the Flying Doctor’s Base at Alice Springs, The Devil’s Marble near Wanchop, Darwin beach and harbour and many other tourist delights to be found en route from Alice Springs to Darwin.

Digitising Technician Note: Film contains footage of the making of “The Overlanders” (1946). Noted by Ben Abbott 09/01/2018

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 3
results.brief_description: Fly fishermen perfect their art for annual assault on trout streams - skill in manipulating the finely woollen line is acquired only after years of patient practice; Australian National Airways take delivery of newest DC-6B airline ‘Beltana’ (arrival at Essendon Airport); Hakoah force Moreland to replay in exciting Dockerty Cup semi-final (soccer).

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description:
Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution.
Made in conjunction with the Frankston Police Community Involvement Programme and Frankston TAFE.
